items.title: Chart of the Day: Can India become a wind energy hub in Asia Pacific ex-China?
items.description: Global onshore wind power project auctions outside China reached record levels in 2024. A large part of the project awards are in India

items.title: Tata Motors board to consider raising Rs 500 crore via securities this week
items.description: A meeting of the duly constituted Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company is scheduled to be held on May 2 to consider and approve the issuance of rated, listed, unsecured, redeemable, non-convertible debentures

items.title: ED conducts search operations at Gensol Engineering premises in Gurugram, Ahmedabad
items.description: The ED action is based on the SEBI order which claimed that Gensol Engineering obtained loans from Power Finance Corporation and IRDEA Ltd for procurement of BluSmart EVs and EPC contracts.

items.title: Not chasing discount-driven growth, says Ather CEO, scaling up lithium-ion cell production
items.description: Ather’s Tarun Mehta said the ongoing tariff tussle is primarily between the US and China, and India, not being directly involved, could benefit.

items.title: Which life insurance company’s stock should investors bet on?
items.description: HDFC Life has the most balanced product mix, ICICI Pru has the most diversified distribution mix, and SBI Life has the lowest cost structure

items.title: TVS continues to maintain growth momentum
items.description: Robust demand from rural and international markets supports quarterly performance

items.title: Will defence stocks be in focus post the Pahalgam terrorist attack?
items.description: The government may prioritise the implementation of key defence programmes

items.title: UltraTech – Operational performance shows the company’s competitive advantage
items.description: The government's commitment to infrastructure and continued momentum in real estate augur well for the cement maker

items.title: Gensol: A fraud in plain sight
items.description: Misuse of related parties to divert funds is not new to India Inc. and is in fact, a well-trodden and time-tested method to commit fraud. Gensol has diligently recorded transfers to related parties as evidenced by SEBI’s review of the bank statements of the company. In essence, the fraud was hidden in plain sight and this begs the question, where were the Board of Directors and the auditors?

items.title: Why this mid-sized IT company could pause for a breather post its outperformance
items.description: Zensar’s commentary about the future is slightly cautious amid macro challenges

items.title: BDR Pharma targeting 2027 for IPO launch, looking to acquire units in US, says CMD Dharmesh Shah
items.description: In the past few years, BDR Pharma has spent close to Rs 600 crore and plans to invest another Rs 700 crore to boost growth and acquisitions over the next three years

items.title: A long-term play on asset financing
items.description: Healthy performance with visible signs of improvement in disbursals, asset quality

items.title: Why consider CSB Bank despite subdued earnings in FY25?
items.description: CSB Bank has articulated its long-term vision, under which, by FY2030, its loan portfolio will be well-diversified with 20% in gold, 30% in retail, 20% in SME and 30% in wholesale and other businesses.

items.title: Green hydrogen producers will have to undergo certification for authenticity of green sources
items.description: The companies on whom this mandate will be applicable include Reliance Green Hydrogen and Green Chemicals, L&T Energy Green Tech, Waaree Clean Energy Solutions, JSW Neo Energy, Welspun New Energy and ACME Cleantech Solutions, among others.
